body_html:
The campaign and team apps are separate apps (hosted on Heroku), so they need their own domain.

Here's how I would do it:

  • Clone https://github.com/rails-girls-summer-of-code/summer-of-code to https://github.com/rails-girls-summer-of-code/summer-of-code-2013, and point the domain 2013.railsgirlssummerofcode.org to it
  • Rename the existing teams app deployments on Heroku rgsoc-teams-production to rgsoc-teams-2013-production and point 2013.teams.railsgirlssummerofcode.org to it. Change rgsoc-teams-staging accordingly.
  • Setup a new deployment (production/staging) of the teams app on Heroku and point teams.railsgirlssummerofcode.org to it.
  • Rename the existing campaign app rgsoc-campaign on Heroku to rgsoc-campaign-2013 and point 2013.campaign.railsgirlssummerofcode.org to it.
  • Setup a new deployment of the campaign app on Heroku and point campaign.railsgirlssummerofcode.org to it.

Gonna assign this to @pxlpnk because he volunteered :)

Here's how I would do it:
- Clone https://github.com/rails-girls-summer-of-code/summer-of-code to https://github.com/rails-girls-summer-of-code/summer-of-code-2013, and point the domain `2013.railsgirlssummerofcode.org` to it

- Setup a new deployment (production/staging) of the teams app on Heroku and point `teams.railsgirlssummerofcode.org` to it.
- Rename the existing campaign app `rgsoc-campaign` on Heroku to `rgsoc-campaign-2013` and point `2013.campaign.railsgirlssummerofcode.org` to it.
- Setup a new deployment of the campaign app on Heroku and point `campaign.railsgirlssummerofcode.org` to it.
